text:
ive been playing with this tinder simulator for the past couple days. ive gotten to the point the results re pretty good

cards are generated in three phases:
- It starts out a phase of “20 questions” style strategy where i try to split up the decks by theme (I.e., for olivia it knows to try to split out stromkirk captain as the first question to determine vamp tribal vs. not)
- Once it narrows it down a bit, it goes into a phase where it just rattles off the top 10 cards from the decks that are left after the splitting
- Now it works with the recommendation engine to pull the top recommendation from the recs. Note that I added “negative” options to the rec engine-- so now saying no to a card actually impacts the results… which is pretty cool.
<@U28TLDP0R> how hard would it be to make an app that did this?
so the initial input is a commander?
and what's the final output?  a 99-card decklist?
Yeah
so what does recommendations have to do with it?
It builds the deck through the rec engine
The 3 phases are invisible to the user. Its just how im deciding which card to show next
so how does the entire experience look on the user-end?

Plug in a commander. Next screen. 

Show a card. 
Swipe left is no, swipe right is yes, swipe down is maybeboard.
Then get next card. Repeat.
Need to think about how to handle basics
I think having a histogram mana curve and a pie chart for types could be appropriate
at what point do the stop the (get next card. repeat) loop
When you get to 99 (barring basics)
hmm
The way i think we handle basics is ask the user how many lands they want to play when selecting the commander. We prefill tbe deck with basic lands
When they select a nonbasic it replaces a basic
I feel like it'd be cooler if we asked them a smaller number of questions (e.g. 20) and then made a solid guess based on their yes/no responses as to what the entire decklist would be
i.e. split the data set 20 times and plug that into the rec engine
Interesting
So one thing i found was that after like 20 swipes i was saying yes every time
Its that good
We could have a button like "fill out rest of deck automatically" that stops the repeat and just autopilots the rest of the way

I'm a fan of putting a hard cap (or maybe not "hard" but based on what percentage of decks remain in the data set) on the number of questions we ask since something like this sounds better for fun / brewing rather than fine tuning a deck, but I do think we'd want a "fill out rest of deck" in any case
Kk
So thats basically what phase 1 is
I stop when i hit <30 decks
Taniwha took 2-3 questions, atraxa like 8
I used a pretty fancy metric for evaluating the card to select for the split
It measures the similarity of the decks ok both sides by calculating the average distance from average.
Then it uses the distance of the two sides
Ie it maximizes two clusters that are cohesive but far apart
Ie stromkirk captain is shit in olivia voldaren non vampire, but good in vamp tribal
Atraxas phase 1 questions figure out if you are doing superfriends, +1/+1 or infect... couldnt get it to pick up energy counters though
Then the top 10 cards from the one left help refine the recs a bit
Then the rec engine is on point throughout
Likely could autopilot after phase 2
I also have envisioned an ability to fine tune decks, keep a catalog of decks and shit like that. But that can be v2 and integrate w edhrec user accounts.
Nice
Saving vr support for v3
Haha vr playtesting. I like it
Strap your phone on!
I kinda like this tinder idea bc its simple from a ui perspective. Can let us test the waters a bit before going big
We can charge like $3 or something
Selecting a commander, swiping left and right, displaying a deck list, saving deck lists to local storage, seems like a week or less of UI work
Less than i expected
Designing and the API to not be slow and shitty is the harder part
Need to download tinder for market research
Idk how slow these recs are but the simplest from a UI perspective would be a stateless api where every step you just send it your current lefts and rights and it gives you the next card
"Sorry im not interested in you, just swiping right for market research"
So its going to be snappy. I can precompute the question trees for each commander
And the top cards for each leaf
The rec engine in my test right now i check the rec engine every 5 cards then pull off the next 5
That takes a couple of secs. But if we keep all those big matrix in memory itll be near instant
Might need new infra to support that
I remember the last time i tried to load all those in memory bad things happened
So basically each deck will only have to make an api hit once every 5 cards after the initial questions which are local.
I could experiment with 10 cards.... or perhaps experiment with just checking the rec engine when the user says no twice
You think you could asynchronously reload the recs with the new cards behind tbe scenes? And if the user moves too fast he just keeps getting the recs from the previous one
What kind of data can you store in the app locally?
Json as files i assume?
Yes json
Yes to asynchronous
i think i got the data to laod from tappedout for the new set
let’s see how nightly does tonight…
<@U28TLDP0R> there was a error in Ramos making him colorless not 5C . I manually edited the json and recreated the SpoilerSet.json thing
i dont know enough about this thing to take it all the way

>>>
when we link to EDHREC, we do a simple link like this: `/route/?cc=Abrade`. If you’d like, we can add utm_source parameters or some other kind of tracking token so you can more easily detect traffic we send you.
from scryfall folks; i don’t think we care
